what: Package for creating Truchet tiles and random mosaics
title: Package for creating Truchet tiles and random mosaics
text: package offers various functions create Truchet tiles arrange mosaics either using random parameters design. package implements: single scale Truchet tiles discussed Smith Boucher 1987 article Leonardo. Flexible Truchet tiles discussed 2013 paper Bosch Colley Journal Mathematics Art. multi-scale Truchet tiles Christopher Carlson explained blog post. hood, functions use package {sf} create manipulate spatial objects. functions create tiles functions arrange tiles mosaic. Since tiles mosaics simple features, can plotted using {ggplot2} geom_sf(). addition, manipulations tiles (buffering) can done using functionality {sf}.

title: Package for creating Truchet tiles and random mosaics
text: Function st_truchet_l() used generate single scale, line-based tiles. Currently following tiles implemented:
code: # Tiles types tile_types <- data.frame(type = c("dl", "dr")) %>%   mutate(tile = 1:n(),          x = 2 * tile %% 2,          y = 2 * tile %/% 2)  # Elements for assembling the mosaic x_c <- tile_types$x y_c <- tile_types$y type <- as.character(tile_types$type)  pmap_dfr(list(x_c, y_c, type), st_truchet_l) %>%   ggplot() +    geom_sf(size = 2) +   geom_text(data = tile_types,             aes(x = x,                 y = y,                 label = type),             nudge_y = 1)

title: Package for creating Truchet tiles and random mosaics
text: Function st_truchet_ss() used assemble mosaic. works pre-set parameters randomize choice tile placement, also accepts data frame inputs greater control mosaic. fully random mosaic:  tiles composed simple feature objects type “LINESTRING”.
code: mosaic <- st_truchet_ss(xlim = c(-5, 5),                         ylim = c(-5, 5))   ggplot() +   geom_sf(data = mosaic,           size = 2)

title: Package for creating Truchet tiles and random mosaics
text: Function st_truchet_flex() used generate single scale, flexible tiles. Currently following tiles implemented:  function creating tiles takes x y coordinates placing tile, type tile, also parameter b (must zero 1) controls shape diagonal line, created using function bezier() {bezier} package. following figure illustrate effect changing b:
code: # Tiles types tile_types <- data.frame(type = c("dl", "dr")) %>%   mutate(tile = 1:n(),          x = 2 * tile %% 2,          y = 2 * tile %/% 2,          b = 1/2)  # Elements for assembling the mosaic x_c <- tile_types$x y_c <- tile_types$y type <- as.character(tile_types$type) b <- tile_types$b  pmap_dfr(list(x_c, y_c, type, b), st_truchet_flex) %>%   ggplot() +    geom_sf(aes(fill = factor(color)),           size = 2) +   geom_text(data = tile_types,             aes(x = x,                 y = y,                 label = type),             nudge_y = 1) #> Linking to GEOS 3.9.1, GDAL 3.2.1, PROJ 7.2.1; sf_use_s2() is TRUE # Tiles types tile_types <- data.frame(b = seq(0, 1, length.out = 10)) %>%   mutate(tile = 1:n(),          type = "dr",          x = 2 * tile %% 2,          y = 2 * tile %/% 2)  # Elements for assembling the mosaic x_c <- tile_types$x y_c <- tile_types$y type <- as.character(tile_types$type) b <- tile_types$b  pmap_dfr(list(x_c, y_c, type, b), st_truchet_flex) %>%   ggplot() +    geom_sf(aes(fill = factor(color)),           size = 1) +   geom_text(data = tile_types,             aes(x = x,                 y = y,                 label = as.character(round(b, 2))),             nudge_y = 1)

text: Using function st_truchet_p() type “dl” “dr” produces simple features data frame elements single tile, diagonal left (“\”) diagonal right (“/”). addition geometry spatial elements tiles, data frame includes identifiers tiles (.e., tile 1 “\” tile 2 “/”) well colors. function accepts coordinates tile.

title: Package for creating Truchet tiles and random mosaics
text: Carlson’s tiles designed work multiple scales. moment, function create tiles supports scale 1 (tiles squares sides length 1), scale 1/2 (sides tile length 1/2), scales 1/4 (sides tile length 1/4). don’t see much point tiles smaller , effect can replicated bigger tiles bigger mosaics, used multi-scale mosaics, detail lost smaller scales. Argument scale_p used select scale output tile (default 1). Notice colors alternate scale.
code: ggplot() +   geom_sf(data = st_truchet_p(x = 0, y = 0, type = "dl", scale_p = 1),           aes(fill = factor(color))) +   geom_sf(data = st_truchet_p(x = 2, y = 0, type = "dl", scale_p = 1/2),           aes(fill = factor(color))) +   geom_sf(data = st_truchet_p(x = 4, y = 0, type = "dl", scale_p = 1/4),           aes(fill = factor(color)))

what: Assembling a mosaic with multi-scale tiles
title: Package for creating Truchet tiles and random mosaics
text: possible assemble tiles mosaic manually, additional function offers functionality task. Function st_truchet_ms() can used default parameters. default uses tiles type dl dr, positioned random (equal probability) mosaic:  possible create mosaics tiles different sizes; parameters p1, p2, p3 control proportion tiles scale:  Mosaics can use different types tiles:
code: st_truchet_ms() %>%   ggplot() +   geom_sf(aes(fill = factor(color)),           color = NA) st_truchet_ms(p1 = 0.6, p2 = 0.3, p3 = 0.1) %>%   ggplot() +   geom_sf(aes(fill = factor(color)),           color = NA) st_truchet_ms(tiles = c("-", "|", "dl")) %>%   ggplot() +   geom_sf(aes(fill = factor(color)),           color = NA)

title: Package for creating Truchet tiles and random mosaics
text: tiles currently implemented:
code: # Tiles types tile_types <- data.frame(type = c("dl", "dr", "-", "|", "fnw", "fne", "fsw", "fse", "+", "+.", "x.", "tn", "ane", "asw")) %>%   mutate(tile = 1:n(),          x = 2 * tile %% 5,          y = 2 * tile %/% 5)  # Elements for assemblig the mosaic x_c <- tile_types$x y_c <- tile_types$y type <- as.character(tile_types$type) scale_p <- rep(1, nrow(tile_types))  pmap_dfr(list(x_c, y_c, type, scale_p), st_truchet_p) %>%   ggplot() +    geom_sf(aes(fill = factor(color))) +   geom_text(data = tile_types,             aes(x = x,                 y = y,                 label = type),             nudge_y = 1)
